The team investigator collaboration researcher community service provider commit develop prevention intervention employ holistic culturally relevant approach . This include recognize impact force racism , sexism , gender expectation individual behavior relationship dynamic African American community . Specifically , investigator hypothesis compare control condition FemAALES intervention arm reduce risky sexual behavior STI ( sexually transmit infection ) incidence increase condom self-efficacy risk behavior communication sexual partner .
DOC.brief_title: Females African American Legacy Empowering Self ( FemAALES )
DOC.detailed_description: Two third female HIV/AIDS case occur Black woman estimate 76 % attribute heterosexual contact . HIV third-leading killer Black woman age 25-44 , STI associate morbidity may contribute racial disparity cervical cancer , adverse pregnancy outcome , infant mortality . The investigator propose test efficacy FemAALES African American Legacy Empowering Self Intervention population adult Black/African American woman either health insurance public/subsidized form health insurance Control `` Standard Care '' arm involve family plan STI counseling . In addition , investigator explore impact FemAALES intervention use new medium social support networking , obtain health information , identify resource service . FemAALES incorporate cultural contextual , partnership issue promote access resource readily available population . FemAALES curriculum guide Theory Reasoned Action Planning Critical Thinking Cultural Affirmation Model develop collaborate community-based organization . The primary specific aim : 1 . Determine impact FemAALES African American Legacy Empowering Self ( FemAALES II ) HIV risk factor include : 1. number sex partner 2. unprotected anal/vaginal sex 3. incidence bacterial STIs 2 . Determine impact FemAALES intervention psychosocial outcome , include self-efficacy safer sex negotiation discussion partner regard HIV/STI test risk - Hypothesis 1 : Compared control , FemAALES reduce number vaginal/anal sex partner number episode unprotected intercourse 3months 9 month post intervention - Hypothesis 2 : Compared control , FemAALES reduce incidence gonorrhea chlamydia - Hypothesis 3 : Compared control , FemAALES improve self-efficacy condom negotiation - Hypothesis 4 : Compared control . FemAALES increase proportion woman discussion regard sexual drug use risk factor sexual partner . A third , exploratory aim , assess impact FemAALES intervention use new social medium social support networking , obtain health information identify resource service .
